message.content:
cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SE

The paper discusses the use of decision trees with linear classifiers for representation of strategies in graph games and MDPs. This involves machine learning techniques and optimization algorithms, which are commonly studied in the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also deals with the representation of strategies in reactive systems, which is a topic in the sub-category of cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper involves the use of data structures and algorithms for efficient representation of strategies, which is a topic in the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, and cs.SE, in that order.
